context: The Estonian word 'filmi' is the partitive case form of the noun 'film', meaning 'a movie' or 'a film'. In Estonian, nouns change their endings depending on grammatical case. The partitive case (-i ending) is used when referring to an indefinite amount of something, when talking about a portion of something, or in certain other grammatical contexts. It's commonly used with verbs like 'to watch' (vaatama), 'to see' (nägema), 'to make' (tegema), etc.
